content:
# The copper furnace has not produced any additional copper plates, and the inventory reflects that we still have only 15 coal and 5 stone. 
# The copper furnace is currently working on 12 units of copper ore, but it seems to have stalled in production.

# The first furnace is still idle due to a lack of iron ore, which means we need to gather more iron ore to keep our iron plate production going.

# Given that we have enough copper ore, we should focus on gathering iron ore to ensure both furnaces can operate effectively.
# Let's move to the nearest iron ore patch to gather more iron ore.

# Move to the nearest iron ore position to gather more resources.
iron_position = nearest(Resource.IronOre)
if iron_position:
    move_to(iron_position)  # Move to the location of iron ore
    harvest_resource(iron_position, quantity=10)  # Gather more iron ore
else:
    print("No nearby iron ore patches available!")  # Nothing to gather

# After gathering iron ore, we will check the inventory.
print(f"Inventory changed to {inspect_inventory()} after gathering iron ore.")  # Check inventory after gathering iron ore
print(f"Entities on the map: {get_entities()} after gathering resources.")  # Check entities status again.
